question.body: Which sphincter would not have food in some form (bolus, chyme, feces) passing through it when it relaxes?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The lower esophageal sphincter connects esophagus to the stomach.
Incorrect. The pyloric sphincter connects stomach to small intestine.
Correct. The hepatopancreatic sphincter controls emptying of bile and pancreatic juice into the duodenum, but no food passes through it.
Incorrect. The internal anal sphincter controls the emptying of the large intestine to outside body.

part.hint: All of these sphincters control the rate of material moving through the lumen of the tube, but only one of these has a secretion produced by accessory organs moving through the sphincter-controlled opening; all the others have food moving through the sphincter-controlled opening between different organs of the GI tract.
